Cuerpo: Server: Netscape-Communications/1.1 Date: Tuesday, 26-Nov-96 02:45:42 GMT Last-modified: Monday, 18-Nov-96 14:58:23 GMT Content-length: 5015 Content-type: text/html Ju-Yeon Jo's Home Page Welcome to Ju-Yeon Jo's home page My daughter, Danyoung Ada Kim. She is named from Byron King, Ada, Countess of Lovelace - The first computer programmer. Want to see my pictures? click here. I am a Ph.D candidate in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at Case Western Reserve University and a research assistant at the Center for Automation and Intelligent Systems Research (CAISR). I got my M.S degree from the University of Connecticut , specializing in Computer Graphics and Image Processing. Research Areas Software Engineering, 3D Graphical Simulation, Virtual Reality. Implementing 3D graphical simulations of the AGILE MANUFACTURING workcell using TELEGRIP on Silicon Graphics Indigo2. Recent Publications Journal Papers: "An Agile Manufacturing Workcell Design" with Roger Quinn et al., IIE Transactions. (To be published in an upcoming issue.) Conference Papers: "A New Role of Graphical Simulation: Software Testing" with Yoohwan Kim, Scott Ameduri, and Andy Podgurski. 30th Annual Simulation Symposium, April, 1997, Atlanta, Georgia. (submitted) "Virtual Testing of Agile Manufacturing Software Using 3D Graphical Simulation" with Yoohwan Kim, Andy Podgurski, and Wyatt Newman. (submitted) "A Flexible Software Architecture for Agile Manufacturing" with Yoohwan Kim et al., 1997 IEEE Internation Conference on Robotics and Automation, April, 1997, Albuquerque, New Mexico. (submitted) "Advances in Agile Manufacturing." (submitted) "Design of an Agile Manufacturing Workcell for Light Mechanical Applications" with Roger Quinn et al., 1996 IEEE Robotics and Automation Conference Proceedings, Minneapolis, Minnesota April, 1996. with Roger Quinn et al., 1997 IEEE Internation Video Conference on Robotics and Automation, April, 1997, Albuquerque, New Mexico. (submitted) "Agile Manufacturing Workcell for Light Mechanical Assembly" with Roger Quinn et al., 1996 IEEE Robotics and Automation Conference Video Proceedings, Minneapolis, Minnesota April, 1996. SILMA: A Division of Adept Technology, Inc. for Graphical Simulation 1996 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation .
